org.influxdata.platform

Interface TaskClient


  • public interface TaskClient
    The client of the InfluxData Platform that implement Task HTTP API endpoint.
    Author:
    Jakub Bednar (bednar@github) (11/09/2018 07:54)

    • Method Detail

      • createTask

        @Nonnull
Task createTask(@Nonnull
                         Task task)
        Creates a new task. The Task.getFlux() has to have defined a cron or a every repetition by the option statement.

        Flux example: 

         option task = {
     name: "mean",
     every: 1h,
 }

 from(bucket:"metrics/autogen")
     |> range(start:-task.every)
     |> group(columns:["level"])
     |> mean()
     |> yield(name:"mean")
        Parameters:
        task - the task to create
        Returns:
        Task created

      • createTaskCron

        @Nonnull
Task createTaskCron(@Nonnull
                             String name,
                             @Nonnull
                             String flux,
                             @Nonnull
                             String cron,
                             @Nonnull
                             User owner,
                             @Nonnull
                             Organization organization)
        Creates a new task with task repetition by cron. The Task.getFlux() is without a cron or a every repetition. The repetition is automatically append to the option statement.
        Parameters:
        name - description of the task
        flux - the Flux script to run for this task
        cron - a task repetition schedule in the form '* * * * * *'
        owner - the user that owns this Task
        organization - the organization that owns this Task
        Returns:
        Task created

      • createTaskCron

        @Nonnull
Task createTaskCron(@Nonnull
                             String name,
                             @Nonnull
                             String flux,
                             @Nonnull
                             String cron,
                             @Nonnull
                             String userID,
                             @Nonnull
                             String orgID)
        Creates a new task with task repetition by cron. The Task.getFlux() is without a cron or a every repetition. The repetition is automatically append to the option statement.
        Parameters:
        name - description of the task
        flux - the Flux script to run for this task
        cron - a task repetition schedule in the form '* * * * * *'
        userID - an id of the user that owns this Task
        orgID - an id of the organization that owns this Task
        Returns:
        Task created

      • createTaskEvery

        @Nonnull
Task createTaskEvery(@Nonnull
                              String name,
                              @Nonnull
                              String flux,
                              @Nonnull
                              String every,
                              @Nonnull
                              User owner,
                              @Nonnull
                              Organization organization)
        Creates a new task with task repetition by duration expression ("1h", "30s"). The Task.getFlux() is without a cron or a every repetition. The repetition is automatically append to the option statement.
        Parameters:
        name - description of the task
        flux - the Flux script to run for this task
        every - a task repetition by duration expression
        owner - the user that owns this Task
        organization - the organization that owns this Task
        Returns:
        Task created

      • createTaskEvery

        @Nonnull
Task createTaskEvery(@Nonnull
                              String name,
                              @Nonnull
                              String flux,
                              @Nonnull
                              String every,
                              @Nonnull
                              String userID,
                              @Nonnull
                              String orgID)
        Creates a new task with task repetition by duration expression ("1h", "30s"). The Task.getFlux() is without a cron or a every repetition. The repetition is automatically append to the option statement.
        Parameters:
        name - description of the task
        flux - the Flux script to run for this task
        every - a task repetition by duration expression
        userID - an id of the user that owns this Task
        orgID - an id of the organization that owns this Task
        Returns:
        Task created

      • updateTask

        @Nonnull
Task updateTask(@Nonnull
                         Task task)
        Update a task. This will cancel all queued runs.
        Parameters:
        task - task update to apply
        Returns:
        task updated

      • getRuns

        @Nonnull
List<Run> getRuns(@Nonnull
                           Task task)
        Retrieve list of run records for a task.
        Parameters:
        task - task to get runs for
        Returns:
        the list of run records for a task

      • getRuns

        @Nonnull
List<Run> getRuns(@Nonnull
                           Task task,
                           @Nullable
                           Instant afterTime,
                           @Nullable
                           Instant beforeTime,
                           @Nullable
                           Integer limit)
        Retrieve list of run records for a task.
        Parameters:
        task - task to get runs for
        afterTime - filter runs to those scheduled after this time
        beforeTime - filter runs to those scheduled before this time
        limit - the number of runs to return. Default value: 20.
        Returns:
        the list of run records for a task

      • getRuns

        @Nonnull
List<Run> getRuns(@Nonnull
                           String taskID,
                           String orgID)
        Retrieve list of run records for a task.
        Parameters:
        taskID - ID of task to get runs for
        orgID - ID of organization
        Returns:
        the list of run records for a task

      • getRuns

        @Nonnull
List<Run> getRuns(@Nonnull
                           String taskID,
                           @Nonnull
                           String orgID,
                           @Nullable
                           Instant afterTime,
                           @Nullable
                           Instant beforeTime,
                           @Nullable
                           Integer limit)
        Retrieve list of run records for a task.
        Parameters:
        taskID - ID of task to get runs for
        orgID - ID of organization
        afterTime - filter runs to those scheduled after this time
        beforeTime - filter runs to those scheduled before this time
        limit - the number of runs to return. Default value: 20.
        Returns:
        the list of run records for a task
